docs.lead_paragraph: A man told police he poured vodka into the IV feeding tube of his girlfriend's disabled 13-year-old son to settle him down, a dose of alcohol that contributed to his death, according to court documents released Wednesday.

headline.main: Mom, Beau Plead Not Guilty in Alcohol-In-IV Death
headline.print_headline: Mom, Beau Plead Not Guilty in Alcohol-In-IV Death

docs.snippet: A man told police he poured vodka into the IV feeding tube of his girlfriend's disabled 13-year-old son to settle him down, a dose of alcohol that contributed to his death, according to court documents released Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Italy's interior minister has ordered mayors to stop recognizing the validity of gay marriages performed outside the country, prompting protests from rights groups and local officials.

headline.main: Italian Minister Tells Mayors to Stop Recognizing Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Italian Minister Tells Mayors to Stop Recognizing Gay Marriage

docs.snippet: Italy's interior minister has ordered mayors to stop recognizing the validity of gay marriages performed outside the country, prompting protests from rights groups and local officials.

docs.lead_paragraph: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today:
docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today:

docs.lead_paragraph: Early studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers.

headline.main: Health Law Drug Plans Are Given a Check-Up
headline.print_headline: Health Law Drug Plans Are Given a Check-Up

docs.abstract: Two new studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers; studies also find that insurers are not spending more on exchange enrollees for drug coverage, since patients are being asked to pay more out-of-pocket.
docs.snippet: Early studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The retailer said it would terminate coverage for about 5 percent of its part-time force because of cost increases under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Walmart to End Health Coverage for 30,000 Part-Time Workers
headline.print_headline: 30,000 Lose Health Care Coverage at Walmart

docs.abstract: Walmart Stores says it will terminate coverage for about 30,000 part-time workers, or 5 percent of its part-time force, because of cost increases under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: The retailer said it would terminate coverage for about 5 percent of its part-time force because of cost increases under the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: This year people will again be buying health insurance without a simple way to check which doctors and hospitals are in their network.

headline.main: HealthCare.gov Still Suffers From Lack of Transparency

docs.snippet: This year people will again be buying health insurance without a simple way to check which doctors and hospitals are in their network.
